abstract: An attribute that represents grammatical agreement for objects that aren’t part of the inflected text.
overview:
## Overview

Use this formatting attribute for cases where you need to inflect text based on a term of address or phrase that’s not part of the inflected text.

### Agree with a term of address

In languages that rely on gender, the words and phrases in a sentence need to grammatically agree. For example, suppose you need to translate the following sentence into Spanish: *Anne is busy.*

The challenge is that the system doesn’t know the preferred term of address for the person named *Anne*. Additionally, most often, the localization file only contains masculine forms of translated words. This means the system can’t correctly inflect other words in the sentence, such as *busy*, to agree with Anne’s feminine name. So the resulting translation is: *Anne está occupado*. *Ocupado* is masculine, which isn’t the correct gender agreement for the sentence.

This is where the `agreeWithConcept` attribute can help. By wrapping the word you want to seek agreement on, *ocupado*, in an `agreeWithConcept` attribute pointing to an inflection concept of type [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/InflectionConcept/termsOfAddress(_:)], the system makes the masculine word *ocupado* agree with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/TermOfAddress/feminine] term of address *Anne*. You don’t need to include masculine and feminine forms of the translated words in your localization files. The system makes the terms agree for you.

The following steps ensure proper gender agreement in the translation:

### Agree with a localized phrase

Using a localized phrase for grammatical agreement is the same as using a term of address except you inflect on an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/InflectionConcept/localizedPhrase(_:)] instead of a term of address.

For example, suppose you need to translate the following sentence for a food order into Spanish: *Last time you ordered the small.*

In English, the word *small* can appear on its own. But in Spanish, that translated word needs to agree with the masculine or feminine noun it’s describing, which, in this case (*ensalada*), isn’t part of the sentence.

To achieve agreement, wrap the masculine word for *small*, *pequeño*, with the `agreeWithConcept` attribute. Then set it to point to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/InflectionConcept/localizedPhrase(_:)] that matches its associated food item.

The following steps ensure proper gender agreement in the translation:

items.description: A scope for accessing an inflection rule attribute.
items.name: inflect

items.description: A type for using an inflection rule as an attribute.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.InflectionRuleAttribute

items.description: A scope for accessing an agreement argument attribute.
items.name: agreementArgument

items.description: An attribute that represents grammatical agreement with an argument in a localized string.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.AgreementArgumentAttribute

items.description: A scope for accessing an agreement concept attribute.
items.name: agreementConcept

items.description: A scope for accessing a morphology attribute.
items.name: morphology

items.description: A type for using a morphology as an attribute.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.MorphologyAttribute

items.description: A scope for accessing a referent concept attribute.
items.name: referentConcept

items.description: An attribute that specifies a grammatical agreement concept for substituting pronouns in localized text.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.ReferentConceptAttribute

items.description: A scope for accessing an inflection alternative attribute.
items.name: inflectionAlternative

items.description: An attribute that provides an alternative inflection phrase when the system can’t achieve grammatical agreement.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.InflectionAlternativeAttribute

title: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.AgreementConceptAttribute
